poem:
"Rafah: Realm Relocated"

Yet Rafah, once a refuge, swells
with wandering spirits worn and detain.
Amid the echo of eviction bells,
Hope clings tightly, in silent refrain. 
Where homes crumble to earth-infused stains,
Fallen feathers dreaming of flight.
Rafah, once a city, bearing invisible strains.
Now, a sanctuary of souls, in night.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Multiple evacuation orders ensued, and it is now estimated that more than 1.5 million Palestinians are taking refuge in and around the southern city of Rafah, vastly swelling its pre-war population of 280,000.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
